intro: Verbascum macrosepalum, commonly known as the large-sepal mullein. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, characterized by its tall, hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its fuzzy, velvety leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Verbascum macrosepalum is valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional medicine.
